Fine, I'll list both sides 
Pros:
- Large amount of burst
- Strong early to mid game
- Safer laning phase
- Damage given to him in his kit
- Has 2  situational (against a good team you won't escape and if you REALLY want to kill someone, you'll generally have to Press W to get the increased damage) escapes
- Passive that increases his ability to cs
- Destroys teams that have poor co-ordination
- No mana
-Diverse playpath

Cons:
- Later stages of the game suck for Zed. In fact, the moment people begin to group does he lose an insane amount of threat, no longer being able to just simply outplay a single opponent
- His ultimate puts him in a horrible spot 90% of the time
-His Energy costs are so high. One ability is Half of his Maximum energy. That's the point, he is supposed to do a lot of damage with the abilities he uses, then get out.
-Unreliable escape
- 2 items that counter him hard, and remove all of his ult's damage in 2 ways each
- His Escape is used as a way to poke, as a way to fight, and an escape. The cooldown is so long that you can't use it in all 3 ways in an effectively timed manner. 
- Tahm Kench, Alistar, Braum, Orianna, Janna, etc. counter him hard with their insane amount of lockdown/peel or both.

If you've noticed, these aren't the only pros and cons to Zed. But rather, the ones I can think of off the top of my head. He does a large amount of damage, but it's done in 2 parts.
And btw, you can't think of balance of a champion and add items or kills to them, because that's not what they are designed around, they are designed around their own kit and resources inside of it, so I wont think of Zed like that.

Zed is the posterboy for assassins because he has the most counterplay out of all the other assassins (in most cases).

compare fighting a Zed to fighting a Talon/Rengar/Katarina/

first of all WHILE ZED ULTS YOU youve got about .75-1 second to react to him ulting you. You can flassh to a teammate, flash as soon as he comes out, Zhonya's,Trollpole w/e you have

2. the large part of his burst is on a delay. If the deathmark does not pop you generally wont die. If you can find someway to rapidly heal yourself or shield yourself then you will most likely survive Zeds encounter.

3. Zeds early-mid game is strong but late game he must play more carefully. Much like Riven careless play will lead to a throw. in order to keep himself relevant he usually has to supplement himself with health or a Guardian Angel.

4.no stealth= easier to read. If a zed uses his shadow to make a straight B-line for your Ashe then you KNOW whats about to go down. this allows supports to react accordingly and the ADC to start backing up. having no stealth also means a Zed must rely on trickier positioning and use of brush.

Thats why Riot loves Zed. Hes strong but generally fair. After a certain point in the game him Ulting you could mean death for either of you.
